intro: Perezia pedicularidifolia, commonly known as the clustered perezia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming dense rosettes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Perezia pedicularidifolia is considered a rare and endangered species.
